subject: Re: [junit] Not knowing the tests in advance when providing a test runner
msgSnippet: JUnit reports tests that fails their assumption as Assumption Failed .  Most runners translate this into Passed , since most of the runners haven t grown new
messageBody:
JUnit reports tests that fails their assumption as "Assumption
Failed". Most runners translate this into "Passed", since most of the
runners haven't grown new UI for the new status.

David Saff

2011/6/27 Cédric Beust ♔ <cedric@...>:
> On Fri, Jun 24, 2011 at 2:36 PM, Bill Venners <bill@...> wrote:
>
>> The skipped concept shows up in JUnit as assumptions, and in TestNG as
>> dependent tests, I think.
>>
>
> I think that JUnit marks tests that fail their assumption as "Failed", while
> TestNG marks them as "Skipped" (a status which doesn't exist in JUnit
> AFAIK).
>
> --
> Cédric
